intro: Epilasia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate epilasia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of North America, particularly in the central and western United States. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and prairies. It features basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Epilasia intermedia is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
